meanings.definition: The act of urging or encouraging someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her constant urgings for him to study paid off when he aced the test.
meanings.sent2: I could not resist his urgings to join him on the adventure.
meanings.sent3: His urgings to eat the last cookie were so persuasive that I gave in.
meanings.sent4: The urgings of the coach echoed in his mind as he pushed himself to run faster.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's urgings to be kind to one another stayed with the students long after class ended.

meanings.sent1: His urgings to explore the unknown were always met with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The urgings of hunger drove her to raid the fridge for a midnight snack.
meanings.sent3: The cat's urgings for attention were hard to ignore as it meowed persistently.
meanings.sent4: The urgings of the heart can sometimes lead us to unexpected places.
meanings.sent5: The urgings of curiosity propelled him to ask endless questions about the world around him.
